revised_title: Synthesis and Properties of Methionine Sulfoximine and Other Sulfoximines
tldr: The authors synthesized methionine sulfoximine and other sulfoximines by reacting hydrazoic acid with corresponding sulfides in the presence of concentrated sulfuric acid. Methionine sulfoximine, a toxic compound, was isolated from nitrogen trichloride-treated proteins. The reaction mechanism between hydrazoic acid and a sulfide is discussed, and the properties of sulfoximines are explored.
